body.p:
Hopkinsville Kentucky October 27" 1865
Governor Bramlette
Dr Sir

At September Term 1865 of the Christian Circuit Court a judgment was obtained by the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Jos McCarroll and Jno,, B,, Gowan as bail (for One Jesse Gray a free negro indicted for Grand Larceny) for $500 and also against Jos McCarroll for $100 as bail for Jesse Gray in another case Gray ran off and left the State,, Jos McCarroll is Sheriff of Chirstian Co and Gowan his deputy Sheriff,, they have had a hard time during the War and had no business to go as bail for Jesse Gray,, but on account of difficulties encountered by them during the War in discharge of their duties as Sheirff and the fact they have had a bad chance to make money as Sheriff of
this Christian Co and that their experience in this matter will teach them a lesson in regard to bail bonds hereafter,, I recommend them for executive clemency and remission of said judgments fo $500 and $100 --

I am Yours truly
E P,, Campbell atty for Commonwealth
